title: chore: update deps and fix clippy lints
body:
Simply bumping all dependencies to the latest version, and auto-fixing (with `cargo clippy --fix`) any currently reported lint warnings from Clippy.

I bumped the Rust version in the Dockerfile to the latest version, as it failed to compile. That's due to several MSRV bumps in the dependencies.

title: chore: ignore website with github linguist
feat(link): link only dotfiles with diff
Refactor/paths
body:
closes #139
closes #106

title: fix: display undeclared variables when rendering templates
body: closes #107

title: Add bombadil watch feature
body:
Fixes #112.

I didn't write a test for this because frankly I think this is a hard thing to test but I can try if required.

title: Test/sealed test
body:
This PR refactors the whole test suite to use [sealed_test](https://crates.io/crates/sealed_test) on tests that uses 
bombadil link and bombadil install commands. 

Once the refactor is completed, these test will run on tmpfs with a fake home directory this way we can run the test suite
locally without overriding existing user dotfiles.

body: closes #87

title: Chore/update clap
body:
closes #91 
closes #62
partially address #106

title: Fix Arch installation instructions in book

title: Website update
body:
Hey :)

I thought it would be nice to have an official statement for the v3 update and a few docs adjustments on the website to display the new features available via v3.0.0 .

Feel free to close this, if you plan on writing this yourself :smile:

title: Add updated installation instructions for Arch Linux
body: I just slapped toml-bombadil into [community] so the README should be updated accordingly.

title: Add codecov.yml and configure a threshold of 1%
body: This is important when using codecov so we don't get silly failures like in #78.

body:
Bumps [anyhow](https://github.com/dtolnay/anyhow) from 1.0.53 to 1.0.55.
Release notes

Sourced from anyhow's releases.

1.0.55

  • Documentation improvements

1.0.54

  • Construct more helpful error message from ensure! when the expression involves a negative literal const generic as the first generic argument of a method call (#224)
Commits
  • 3ca5036 Release 1.0.55
  • 6a31772 Add link from Context docs to Display representations

  • c38e117 Handle negative literal const generic argument after left arrow
  • c36c0fd Add test of negative literal
  • 91b027e Add test of literal in const generic path argument
  • 23a7fd5 Update ensure tests to nightly-2022-02-07

title: Remove DSpeckhals example repositories
body:
Since this commit https://github.com/DSpeckhals/dotfiles/commit/5f0710d6c850a704b6440a9057ed0e9a2c1bb6c4
The following _example repository_ https://github.com/DSpeckhals/dotfiles has moved away from toml-bombadil

Can be confusing for user to be redirect to some repo where missing bombadil.toml
